hackathon-description-text: HackUMBC gives you 24 hours to learn new skills, make friends, create your wildest idea, and share it with the world. Whether you wish to build a website, dabble with Photoshop, create a robotic arm, or develop a game, it's up to you to decide what to learn!

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Lecturer Computer Science and Electrical Engineering
Professor of Computer Science and Electrical Engineering
Professor of Computer Science and Electrical Engineering

hackathon-rules:
All Hacks must adhere to the MLH Code of Conduct
The maximum team size of four.
All projects must start fresh at the hackathon.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Borlee Mini Desktop 3D printers for each member of the team for winning the first place prize
Amazon Echos for each member of the team for winning the second place prize
Pebble Times rewarded to each member of the team.
Design a project that addresses a social justice issue
SADES A60/OMG PC Computer Over Ear Stereo Headphones With Microphone Noise Isolating Volume Control LED Light
Exclusive Lyft Backpacks + Lyft Swag + $20 Lyft credits each
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best use of the Lyft API

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Build a software solution that can help reduce the frequency and/or severity of online harassment.

Everything is part of the internet of things now - from your phone to your fitness band to your thermostat. Build a hack that utilizes private data being collected from your devices, and show how you can turn potential vulnerabilities into something constructive.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Watch Dogs® 2 Best Device Privacy Hack
Best Use of Amazon Website Services
Best Use of Domain.com (Punniest Domain Name)

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: This prize goes out to the hack that is most game changing/ disrupts the industry. The winning team will get $250 Amazon gift cards.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Booz Allen Hamilton Most Game Changing Hack

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Fitbit 2's will be rewarded to the team that has the most innovative RC Car hack!
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: STEER Most Innovative RC Car Hack
Northrop Grumman's Best Software Enabled Hardware Hack

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=Information Technology/ Engineering, 1000 Hilltop Cir, Baltimore, MD 21250, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Is the hack Technically interesting or difficult? Is it just a wrapper for an API, or were there real technical challenges to overcome?
Is the hack usable in its current state? Is the user experience smooth? Does everything appear to work? Is it well designed?
Is it a unique idea? Has it been done before? Does it do something novel, or at least take a new approach to an old problem?
Is the hack practical? Is it something people would actually use? Does it fulfill a real need people have?

hackathon-location-address: Information Technology/ Engineering, 1000 Hilltop Cir, Baltimore, MD 21250, USA
